meanings.definition: A person or group that establishes a corporation.
meanings.sent1: The incorporators signed the official documents to create the company.
meanings.sent2: The group of incorporators worked together to form the new business.
meanings.sent3: The three friends jokingly called themselves the 'incorporators' club.
meanings.sent4: The incorporators were like architects, building the foundation of the corporation.
meanings.sent5: The diligent incorporators laid the groundwork for the successful company.

meanings.sent1: As an incorporator of flavors, she mixed the ingredients to create a delicious dish.
meanings.sent2: The artist was known as a skilled incorporator of various art styles.
meanings.sent3: The cat was an expert incorporator of naps into its daily routine.
meanings.sent4: She was an incorporator of ideas, blending creativity with practicality.
meanings.sent5: The scientist was an exceptional incorporator of knowledge, always expanding his understanding.
